quoteFirst: On the left the attack was carried on by the 11th and 12th Royal Scots[77] and the “Rifles,” the K.O.S.B. being in reserve. The advance of the brigade began at
quoteLast: , and with incredible coolness the infantry pressed through the enemy’s barrage and reached the line held by the Fourth Division a few minutes before zero. At 5 P.M. our barrage opened and was excellent, but our men were checked almost at the start by very heavy machine-gun fire.
title: The history of the 9th (Scottish) Division, 1914-1919

quoteFirst: Captain Luce now found himself face to face with a difficult decision, which had to be made promptly. Was he to use his superior speed and endeavour to cut off the _Dresden_ or not? He decided to assist the _Cornwall_ and _Kent_ in order to make sure of the destruction of the _Leipzig_ and _Nürnberg_. At
quoteLast: the _Glasgow_ turned to starboard away from the action and took station on the port quarter of the _Cornwall_, who had by that time come into action with the _Leipzig_.
title: The Battle of the Falkland Islands, Before and After
author: Spencer-Cooper, Henry Edmund Harvey, 1884-1968

quoteFirst: On the night of invasion there was a brilliant moon three days past full. Sunrise was
quoteLast: . The first gleams of daybreak appeared in the north-east as the invaders landed in Canada at Lower Ferry, township of Bertie, county of Welland. At this place there is a shingle factory, a boat-house, a tavern, the residence of a customs officer, and one or two frame dwellings.
title: Narrative of the Fenian invasion of Canada
author: Somerville, Alexander, 1811-1885

quoteFirst: It is scarcely in a condition to offer further resistance; a few more shells, and it will collapse in one mass. On one of its sides, very high up, still hangs the monumental dial of a ruined clock, of which the hands point persistently to
quoteLast: --doubtless the tragic moment at which this giant among Flemish belfries received its death blow.
title: War
author: Loti, Pierre, 1850-1923; Laurie, Marjorie [Translator]

title: Barium: A Cause of the Loco-Weed Disease
